etymologies: Middle English: from Old French loigne, based on Latin lumbus

definitions: the part of the body on both sides of the spine between the lowest (false) ribs and the hipbones.
shortDefinitions: part of body on both sides of spine

definitions: the region of the sexual organs, especially when regarded as the source of erotic or procreative power

examples.text: he felt a stirring in his loins at the thought

shortDefinitions: region of sexual organs regarded as source of erotic or procreative power

definitions: a large cut of meat that includes the vertebrae of the loins
shortDefinitions: joint of meat that includes vertebrae of loins
